title: How to Coat Pork Chops or Chicken

steps.headline: Fill a pie pan with flour to about a 1” (2.54 cm) depth.
Fill another pie pan with breadcrumbs to a 1” (2.54 cm) depth.
Season the flour, the breadcrumbs or both, according to your recipe.
steps.description: Typical breading seasonings for fried pork chops and chicken include salt, black pepper, thyme, marjoram, basil, paprika and garlic powder. You might need to add more seasoned flour or breadcrumbs to the pie pans if you run low as you work.

steps.headline: Beat 1 egg for every 2 pieces of meat with a fork or whisk in a medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Make sure that the bowl is large enough to allow each piece of meat to be dipped in and out of the egg mixture easily.

steps.headline: Dry your meat with paper towels to ensure that your seasonings will adhere to them well.
steps.description: Place them on a large plate lined with more clean paper towels so that they’re within reach to start the breading process.

steps.headline: Put a pork or chicken piece in the flour using your left hand (dry hand).
steps.description: Roll, pat and press the meat into the flour to coat it on both sides.

steps.headline: Dip the floured chicken or pork chop into the beaten egg with your right hand (wet hand).
steps.description: Make this step brief and allow the excess egg to run back into the bowl.

steps.headline: Transfer the meat to your left hand again and gently drop the floured and moistened meat into the dish of breadcrumbs.
Push the surrounding breadcrumbs over the meat with your left hand.
steps.description: Roll, pat and press the pork or chicken into the breadcrumbs to fully coat at sides.

steps.headline: Use your left hand to remove the prepared meat from the breadcrumb dish to a clean platter.

text: Fill a pie pan with flour to about a 1” (2.54 cm) depth.  Fill another pie pan with breadcrumbs to a 1” (2.54 cm) depth.  Season the flour, the breadcrumbs or both, according to your recipe. Typical breading seasonings for fried pork chops and chicken include salt, black pepper, thyme, marjoram, basil, paprika and garlic powder. You might need to add more seasoned flour or breadcrumbs to the pie pans if you run low as you work. Beat 1 egg for every 2 pieces of meat with a fork or whisk in a medium-sized bowl. Make sure that the bowl is large enough to allow each piece of meat to be dipped in and out of the egg mixture easily. Dry your meat with paper towels to ensure that your seasonings will adhere to them well. Place them on a large plate lined with more clean paper towels so that they’re within reach to start the breading process. Put a pork or chicken piece in the flour using your left hand (dry hand). Roll, pat and press the meat into the flour to coat it on both sides. Dip the floured chicken or pork chop into the beaten egg with your right hand (wet hand). Make this step brief and allow the excess egg to run back into the bowl. Transfer the meat to your left hand again and gently drop the floured and moistened meat into the dish of breadcrumbs.  Push the surrounding breadcrumbs over the meat with your left hand. Roll, pat and press the pork or chicken into the breadcrumbs to fully coat at sides. Use your left hand to remove the prepared meat from the breadcrumb dish to a clean platter.  Finished.
